item.title: Master Command
item.dc:creator: @B0SS B0SS
item.description:
@B0SS wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:533748”][quote author=ohokay link=topic=652543.msg4372370#msg4372370 date=1381058102]
It’s probably in the admin commands. Find something like this

if (playerRights >=0) {

[/quote]
From what I recall in later revisions, it doesn’t look like that anymore. They have broken all commands up based on rank. So you’re going to want to add it to the regular command file and add it there.[/quote]it is, its in the command.java file. are they all broken up into separate parts?

Read full topic

item.title: Master Command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:2, topic:533748”]It’s probably in the admin commands. Find something like this

if (playerRights >=0) { [/quote]
From what I recall in later revisions, it doesn’t look like that anymore. They have broken all commands up based on rank. So you’re going to want to add it to the regular command file and add it there.

Read full topic

item.title: Master Command
item.dc:creator: @B0SS B0SS
item.description:
@B0SS wrote:

how would i make master work for everybody even if they’re not owner or anything? im using a a 637 and the code is this but so far it only works for admin

if (command[0].equals("master")) { for (int i = 0; i < 25; i++) { player.getSkills().addExperience(i, Skills.MAXIMUM_EXP);

Read full topic
